Dialogue: I love you, my angel. You don't know how much. The Soldiers pull Isabelle away and lead her up the stairs. Cesaire shakes his cell door with impotent rage.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: Bastards!

Speaker: lucrece
Dialogue: Not so pretty now, is she? The Villagers do not answer. Henri is here, silently fuming. Prudence stands next to him. She looks around.

Speaker: prudence
Dialogue: Where's Peter?

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: I haven't seen him.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: We, Bailiff Attewater, Father Auguste, and Father Solomon of Avignon, having in mind that you, Isabelle Ordeville of Villiers la Croise in the Diocese of Saint-

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Help... Father Auguste stops. The Villagers shift uncomfortably as her helpless voice calls out from inside the mask.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Help me... Please... Help me... The Villagers start to leave, ashamed. Isabelle sees them going... and suddenly SCREAMS.

Speaker: prudence
Dialogue: Isabelle? Can you hear me?

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I can hear you.

Speaker: prudence
Dialogue: Roxanne wanted you to know how sorry she is. She only said those things to save her brother.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I know. Will you tell her that I forgive her?

Speaker: prudence
Dialogue: Of course.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: You don't have to say anything.

Speaker: prudence
Dialogue: I want to.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I think you'd better go now. Prudence looks up. The sun has almost set.

Speaker: prudence
Dialogue: Yes. It won't be long now.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: No one shoots until I give the order. Attewater glances outside and sees Soldiers armed with longbows hidden all around the square. The Captain draws an arrow from his quiver. It's tip is made of silver.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: There. The Captain and Attewater follow his look. A BLACK SHAPE is stealing through the shadows toward Isabelle...

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: Hold your fire... Isabelle frantically tries to free herself, her wrists torn and bleeding, but it's no use. Then, suddenly -- -- something SLAMS into the stocks. BANG! She can't see what it is. The stocks are hit again. Isabelle screams. Suddenly, the Shape moves into her field of view:

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Get away from me!

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: I'm not the Wolf! The moon is out! Look, I haven't turned! Isabelle realizes. He's right. It couldn't be him.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: I'm trying to get you out of this.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Yes! Yes, please hurry! Solomon and his men watch as Henri uses a hammer and chisel to break open the stocks. BANG! BANG!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: He's going to free her. Then: another HOWL. Almost on top of them.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: Patience. It's close now... Henri brings the hammer down again and again and -- BANG! The lock is cleaved in two. Henri throws the stock open and helps Isabelle out of the mask. She looks like hell.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: Can you stand? Isabelle nods. In the loft:

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: Kill him. Attewater gives Solomon a horrified look. The Captain strings an arrow and draws it back, taking aim... Suddenly, Attewater pushes him aside, spoiling the shot. The arrow whizzes by Henri's head. Attewater calls out:

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: We have to get to the stable. Peter left his cart for us.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Peter? Where is he --?

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: It doesn't matter. Come on!

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: The witch has escaped! The witch has escaped!

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: It's gone.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I don't think so... Just then, they pass by the Reeve and a group of Villagers. The Villagers start to give chase, but Isabelle and Henri quickly leave them behind. Meanwhile, the Wolf is shortcutting through the village, racing after the cart. It comes to a sheep pen and smashes through it. It comes to a large barn and leaps onto its roof, then leaps off again -- -- and lands within striking distance of the cart. Henri drives the horse, but it's no use. The Wolf lunges, wrestling the horse to the ground. The horse cries out, its body twisting as it falls, sending the cart flying. Isabelle falls out and lands hard. Henri lies on his side, clutching his wrist. Isabelle pulls herself together and goes to him. She looks at his arm. It's visibly broken. She helps him to his feet -- -- just as the overturned cart is SMASHED apart. The Wolf bursts through it, breaking it to pieces. It glares at them with bloodthirsty eyes. Isabelle and Henri back away from it, but their escape is blocked -- the Villagers have caught up. They freeze at the sight of the Wolf, but stand their ground. Isabelle and Henri are trapped. The Reeve shouts:

Speaker: reeve
Dialogue: Take her! Take her and leave us in peace! The Wolf SNARLS at him and turns to Isabelle.

Speaker: the wolf
Dialogue: You can't outrun me, my dear. And there is no place you can hide that I cannot smell you out.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: My place will never be with you.

Speaker: the wolf
Dialogue: Where do you belong then? Here? With the cowards who so gladly sacrificed you to save themselves?

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: They're still good people.

Speaker: the wolf
Dialogue: They are sheep. We are not like them. Let me show you what you are. The Wolf steps closer... but suddenly, Henri pushes Isabelle aside, pulls his hammer from his belt, and raises it to hit the Wolf.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: Get away from her! The Reeve quickly grabs him. Henri struggles futilely, but Isabelle seizes the distraction. She snatches a Villager's torch and jabs it into the Wolf's side. The Wolf leaps back with an eerily human YELP of pain. Before it can react, Isabelle waves the torch at the Villagers, grabs Henri and they run away. The mob chases after them. Three Soldiers appear and join the mob. Figures silhouetted against the snow, angry faces lit by torchlight. It's like a nightmare. Suddenly, a cottage in front of the mob EXPLODES into pieces and the Wolf bursts out of it. It turns on the Villagers and Soldiers. It picks up a fallen roof beam in its powerful jaws, clenches them, trembling with rage, and snaps the wooden beam in half like a twig. The Villagers run away in fear, but the Soldiers stand their ground and the Wolf attacks. Meanwhile, Isabelle and Henri escape... but there are more Soldiers up ahead. Isabelle and Henri quickly hide.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: I need to tell you something. In case I die.  Your grandmother is the Wolf. Isabelle recoils in disbelief. She shakes her head.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: The Wolf is a man. It told me.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: You believe it? Isabelle hesitates. He has a point. Henri peers out. The Soldiers are closing in on them...

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: They're coming.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Follow me. She takes his hand and leads him away.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: We need to come inside. Quickly.

Speaker: marguerite
Dialogue: Have you lost your mind? If they find her here, they'll kill us, too!

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Then shut up so they don't find her.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: We have to get out of town.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You'll never make it. You can hide here until morning.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: They're searching everywhere. We have to keep moving.

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: You might make it to the church. Even the king cannot violate the protection of sanctuary.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: And the Wolf cannot cross onto holy ground. The three exchange a look. Sounds like a plan.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Can we go out your back window? Roxanne nods. They hurry toward the window, but then:

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: Wait! I have an idea.

Speaker: reeve
Dialogue: They're here! Over here! The two figures run and the Villagers chase after them.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: Can you keep going?

Speaker: roxanne
Dialogue: I can if you can. They run off, chased by the Villagers.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: At least you won't die alone now. Your friends will all hang with you. Suddenly... a long, hideous SNARL. Behind them. Father Solomon turns. Isabelle cranes her neck and sees... the Wolf emerge from the alley she just came out of. Solomon picks up his sword and stands to face it.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: If you come for her, you come through me. The Wolf GROWLS and raises its hackles. Solomon raises his sword. Just then, Henri and Roxanne run into the square, followed by a group of Villagers.

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: Stay back! Henri hurries to Isabelle's side. The Villagers watch, breathless, as Solomon and the Wolf circle one another. Solomon's sword starts to tremble. Sweat breaks out on his brow. The Wolf SNARLS with an almost mocking leer. Then, with a loud battle cry, Solomon charges. The Wolf leaps at him. Solomon raises his sword... ... and the Wolf's jaws clamp onto his wrist. Solomon screams. The Villagers watch, horrified, as the Wolf twists back and forth, like a dog with a chew toy -- -- biting off Solomon's hand. The hand falls into the snow, still clutching the silver sword. Solomon cries out in agony. The Wolf turns toward Isabelle and SNARLS.

Speaker: the wolf
Dialogue: There is your mighty werewolf hunter. Who will save you now?

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: You bastard! You killed my father!

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Henri, what are you doing?

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: I'm not letting it take you. He throws another rock and another. One hits the Wolf in the eye, tearing a gash in its face. The Wolf GROWLS.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: Look! It bleeds! We can kill it if we stand together! The Villagers waver. Henri beseeches them:

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: Father Solomon was one man. His soldiers were mercenaries. But we are a village! The Wolf SNARLS at him, but comes no closer.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: He's right. It's a coward at heart. Look at it. Why doesn't it attack? The Wolf SNARLS louder and takes a step toward her... but then the Merchant picks up a rock and throws it.

Speaker: merchant
Dialogue: You killed my daughter! Then another Villager joins them. The Wolf looks around. Villagers are emerging from the shadows all around it. It's surrounded. And not by a dozen soldiers, but by a solid wall of angry, determined men and women. The Wolf raises its hackles, trying to scare them, but they start closing in, jabbing at it with weapons and farm implements. It snaps and SNARLS at its attackers, but there are too many of them. Someone drives a spear into the Wolf and it screams in agony. It lurches around, biting at the spear, but can't reach it. Then Henri sees something in the snow...

Speaker: the wolf
Dialogue: I will come for you again. And with that, it turns and flees into the night. The Villagers CHEER. The Reeve chases after it and the rest of the angry mob follows him. Henri turns to Isabelle.

Speaker: henri
Dialogue: Are you all right? Isabelle nods, shaky. Then...

Speaker: solomon
Dialogue: I am bitten. Henri and Isabelle exchange a look. A long beat. Henri walks over to Solomon, sword in hand. Solomon crosses himself and closes his eyes, unafraid. Roxanne turns away. Isabelle doesn't. Then Henri swings the sword. There is a soft THUMP as Solomon's head hits the snow. Henri throws the sword aside. Isabelle puts a reassuring hand on his shoulder.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: It's past noon.

Speaker: suzette
Dialogue: I know. I didn't want to wake you. Isabelle smiles up at her. The wounds on Suzette's face are still bad, but healing. She's scarred for life.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Where's Father?

Speaker: suzette
Dialogue: He'll be home soon. They have no reason to hold him any longer.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Did they catch the Wolf?

Speaker: suzette
Dialogue: No. They lost it in the forest. This gives Isabelle pause. A beat. Then:

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: What about Grandmother? Suzette hesitates. Isabelle is suddenly concerned.

Speaker: suzette
Dialogue: Roxanne came by. She said your grandmother has fallen ill. I was hoping you could look in on her. Off Isabelle's troubled look...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Thank God you're all right. He tries to take her hand, but she pulls away. A beat.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I'm fine. You sent Henri to help me.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: What did he tell you? Isabelle gives him a hurt look.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Those people back there. I know they mean well, but they're just people. I didn't expect anything from them. I expected something from you.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I just need to talk to you.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I'm going to see my Grandmother. She's sick. Please don't follow me. Isabelle starts walking again. Peter just stands there, watching her go. When she looks back, he's gone. She sighs, wiping tears from her eyes. She continues on... Then: FOOTSTEPS behind her again. She stops and looks back. Listens. Nothing. She keeps walking. But then she HEARS them again. Looks back. A dark figure follows her in the fog. She walks faster. She reaches the fork in the path. She pauses. The FOOTSTEPS are still behind her. She makes a decision. She breaks off a tree branch and backs toward the abandoned path, using the branch to sweep away her tracks in the snow. When she's far enough away from the main path, she throws the branch aside... ... and turns to face the abandoned path. It looks ominous. She gives it a wary look, then starts walking.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Grandmother? Are you awake? She listens at the door. A long beat. Then:

Speaker: reeve
Dialogue: You're certain nobody has seen him since last night?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: The Wolf must have taken him. What else could have done that? They're looking at the cell where Cesaire was locked up. The metal door has been ripped off its hinges...

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: I've been expecting you. Isabelle starts toward the bedroom with the basket...

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Mother sent some food. There are cakes and a pot of butter --

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: Don't come in here. Isabelle stops short. Grandmother's face is cloaked in darkness. Isabelle gives her a questioning look.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: I'm not hungry right now.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Are you sure? You sound so weak.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: I just made myself a stew. I left it over the fire for you. Isabelle glances back at the pot BUBBLING over the fire.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I came here to take care of you. Not the other way around.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: Don't be silly, my dear. You've been through so much. Sit down. Isabelle considers for a beat, then places the basket on the table, next to a ball of yarn with Grandmother's knitting needles sticking out of it.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: There's no burden so heavy that it doesn't seem a little lighter on a full stomach.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: That's right. Eat up, my dear. Eat up. Isabelle takes a bite of the hot soup. The cat jumps up on the table and lies down next to her, licking its paw.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I've been worried about you. When you didn't come back yesterday, I was afraid...

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: Was I now?

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Yes. He saved my life. Isabelle takes another bite of soup, then pauses. She puts the bowl down and loosens her collar...

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I feel hot all of a sudden.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: It's just the stew warming you. Isabelle hesitates, but keeps eating. Then she takes a closer look at the cat. There's blood on its paw. That's what it has been licking this whole time. Suddenly, Isabelle feels faint. She breaks out in a sweat. She looks at the soup. A thick broth with chunks of white meat...

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: What is this...?

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: If you don't like it, there's wine on the table to wash it down. Isabelle reaches for the bottle with an unsteady hand and pours herself a cup. She takes a sip... and freezes. It's not wine. It's blood. She gags and drops the cup, spilling blood everywhere. The cat jumps away. She looks at the bottle, turns it over. More blood pours out. Isabelle screams and throws it, knocking over the pot and spilling the soup. The Figure laughs.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: Oh, what pretty red lips. Come and give your Granny a kiss, my dear.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I don't think I want to.

Speaker: the figure
Dialogue: Then I will come to you. And with that -- Grandmother slowly starts to move. She groans. She's hurt. She stands up. She's much taller now than she was. As Isabelle watches in mute dread, the Figure pulls off Grandmother's nightgown and cap, hobbles into the firelight, revealing its face...

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: What is this? Where's Grandmother?

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: I'm afraid I ate most of her.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: I didn't want to kill her. But she finally realized what I was.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: You're not the Wolf. You can't be...

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: Look into my eyes. The one part of me I can never change. Isabelle looks into his eyes... and recoils in horror.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Oh, dear God... You killed Lucie? You killed my sister?

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: I did more than that to her. Isabelle steps away from him, mind reeling. He snarls.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: I only wish your mother could have known what I did to her. The girl she passed off as my daughter.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: Lucie was the joy of my life. But she wasn't mine.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Yes, she was. In every way that matters, she was.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: No. Not in every way that matters. My father sired me. I am a werewolf because it was in his blood. Because I was his.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Did Grandmother know?

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: No. And neither does your mother.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: They killed my father. Suddenly, the larger werewolf falls into a pit filled with sharp stakes. It CRIES OUT in agony. The smaller werewolf looks down and WHIMPERS... ... watching as the larger werewolf begins to change before our eyes. It's reverting to its human form...

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: This doesn't concern you, Isabelle.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Yes, Father. Isabelle walks away. Cesaire watches her go...

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: She was not a werewolf yet. I had to turn her. ... the Wolf emerge from the forest with a scrap of bloody meat dangling from its jaws.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: The bite should have changed her. It should have made her like me. But it didn't. That's when I knew. There was no werewolf blood in her. I was not her father. I was so angry. I killed her before I even realized I was doing it.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: Do you see now? This is your heritage. This is what you are. Everything I have done has been to insure the future of our bloodline. We will run together

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: There must indeed be a God. For you are surely the Devil...

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: I will give you a choice. Come with me now. Or refuse me and let your friends suffer in your place. I will kill them one by one. Your mother. Roxanne. Peter. Isabelle shudders. She slowly pulls away and he releases her. She walks over to the table, her back to him. She eyes the ball of yarn with Grandmother's knitting needles in it. A long beat. Isabelle chokes back tears.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Father...? He approaches her. Stands behind her and places his hand on her shoulder. Her skin crawls.

Speaker: cesaire
Dialogue: Yes, my dear?

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: You gave me two choices. She turns to face him. Looks up at him.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: But I have thought of a third. Suddenly -- CRUNCH! Isabelle drives something hard into Cesaire's jaw. He gasps, choking. He puts his had to his throat. Blood spills out through his fingers. CAMERA FINDS Grandmother's ball of yarn on the table. The knitting needles aren't sticking out of it anymore... They're sticking out of Cesaire's neck. He falls to his knees, gagging. Then he flops over dead. Eyes open. Isabelle gazes down at him. She looks like she might have just lost her mind. Then she sits on the floor, staring at his body... and screams. An eruption of rage, betrayal, and heartbreak. She screams.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: People should know what he was.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We can't tell anyone. If they don't believe you, they'll hang you for this. And if they do believe you, they'll hang you for being the daughter of the Wolf.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Then I'll run away. I was ready to run away last night.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I was bitten at the festival. I spent last night in the woods because I was afraid of what might happen...

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: No, you're not. You could never be like him.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I can't stay here.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Yes, you can. We can still be together. My father lived here. My grandfather lived here.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Your father and your grandfather killed people. They couldn't help themselves. If I stay here, I won't be able to control myself.  I have to be alone. Isabelle rests her head on his and they just sit like that, leaning against one another in the candlelight...

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We could take him to the river.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I don't want him ever found.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: We'll weight him with rocks.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: No. We'll put the rocks inside him.  Cut him open. I will sew the rocks inside him. Peter is taken aback. She's serious.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Wait. She pulls back the burlap, revealing Cesaire's dead body. His belly is lumpy and misshapen, an ugly red line in his torso stitched together with black thread. The knitting needles still jut out of his jaw. Isabelle yanks them out, then pulls the burlap back over Cesaire's body. Peter gives her a questioning look.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: These belonged to my grandmother. The knitting needles are covered in blood. Peter takes out a rag and wipes the blood off for her. And as he does... something begins to shine through in the moonlight. Peter gives Isabelle a stunned look.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: They're silver.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: Death was too good for him.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I can live with it.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Where will you go?

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I don't know. I need to understand what I've become. Maybe I can learn to control it.  I'll take my own life before I take another's.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: I know.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: I'm not coming back. I don't want you to wait for me. This is the last time you'll ever see me.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: No, it isn't. You'll be in my dreams until the day I die. Peter turns and starts to walk away. But then he pauses.

Speaker: peter
Dialogue: You know, Henri is a good man.

Speaker: isabelle
Dialogue: Yes, he is. Then Peter continues on until he vanishes in the fog. CAMERA PUSHES IN on Isabelle as she watches him go...
